newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenian shares end week off, slow decline seen.
newsitem.headline: Slovenian shares end week off, slow decline seen.

text.p: Slovenian shares closed 1.36 percent lower on Friday and traders forecast the market could slide by another two to five percent as foreign investors remained absent.
"Banks are expected to set up special accounts for international buyers in two to three weeks. Until then shares may slowly decline," one trader said.

The trader said if international investors decided to invest at least $0.6 million weekly in Slovenian shares, prices would start rising. Alternatively, reluctance to invest in Slovenian securities could push the index down significantly.
The 11-share SBI index fell 19.03 points to 1,385.03 but ended the week 15.63 points higher.
Bank SKB was the most active share, falling 3.40 percent to 56,900 tolars on volume of 1,184 shares for total turnover of 68.6 million tolars.
Turnover fell to 131.5 million tolars from 315 million. Overall eight shares fell, six rose, four were unchanged, seven untraded, while one was traded for the first time.
Brokerage Dadas led the day's decliners, falling 10.46 percent to 5,820 tolars on volume of 35 shares.
Brokerage Finmedia was the biggest gainer, jumping 7.69 percent to 14,000 tolars on volume of 326 shares.
Oils and aroma maker Etol, which on Friday traded on the Ljubljana bourse for the first time, closed at 17,000 tolars, down 2.9 percent from the opening price of 17,500.
